title: DU arts, law, social science intake tests held
body: Tests for admission to the first-year bachelor’s course in arts, law and social sciences of Dhaka University for the 2025–26 academic session were held on Saturday. A total of 107,701 candidates took the tests against 2,934 seats, said a release. The vice-chancellor Niaz Ahmed Khan visited the examinations centre at the social sciences building. Pro-vice-chancellors Sayema Haque Bidisha and Mamun Ahmed, treasurer M Jahangir Alam Chowdhury, social sciences dean Taiabur Rahman, who is also coordinator for admission tests for the units, and proctor Saifuddin Ahmed accompanied him. After the inspection, the vice-chancellor said that the tests were conducted in a disciplined manner. He noted that about 39 candidates were competing for one seat. The admission tests were held simultaneously at Dhaka University and at public universities in seven cities outside Dhaka. The centres outside Dhaka were Rajshahi University, Chittagong University, Barishal University, Khulna University, Shahjalal University of Science and Technology, Bangladesh Agricultural University and Begum Rokeya University. The admission test for science subjects will be held on December 20.
